subject: Sunday Night Preview
event:
The Sunday night preview ran just before the latest episode of BOARDWALK EMPIRE.  If you missed it, it can now be viewed on HBO's GAME OF THRONES site:

http://www.makinggameofthrones.com/

And here's the same trailer, in its YouTube version:

<lj-embed id="104"/>

And the G-Men won too.  What a day...

comments.article: I really can't express how absolutely fabulous everything is looking. You must be very proud! :D
Looks great! I am more than stoked on this whole thing.
comments.subject: Preview

comments.article:
I loved nearly everything I saw <3
This is going to be the best show ever! Congratulations!!!
comments.subject: Amazing!!!!!!!!!!!

comments.article: I love it, but every time I see Sean Bean, I can't help but think "He can be Warden of the North and all, just don't let him have the ring!!!"
Now that really is an awesome trailer. The first really full-on idea of how it's going to look.
I don't think I have ever been this excited for a show ever.

And overall I have to agree, I was quite impressed.

My one quibble though, is that there were no adjectives used when the screen flashed on "Based on the Novels". Perhaps they don't need to go so far as something like "Based on some of the finest novels in modern literature" (though I do think that that phrasing has a nice ring to it), but to simply call them "Novels" and move on? I wish that they had done better on that point. Otherwise, it's indeed looking good.
comments.subject: I happened to catch the Preview

comments.article: can't waiiiiit!
Drogo!!!! Finally!!! ^_^
The casting is ridiculously perfect.
I am getting so excited. Everything looks like what I imagined from the book so far! I can only imagine how excited you are as well!

Bloody Hell.

It´s getting better every second. Bran is so wonderful. And, well, everything, i just don´t know how to explain.

It´s a shame the fact that it´s just 10 chapters, i wonder if that´s enough to represent the book. I miss seeing some scenes with Petyr, varys, and all these characters we haven´t seen yet. But everything i´ve seen is really awesome.

just can´t wait!
That's roughly 80 pages per episode, give or take. That should be fine.

Sadly I think the Making Of site has blocked international traffic for the videos, I've never been able to get them to work with the most recent Adobe player on multiple computers and both IE and Forefox. =(

Sucks, considering I'm in Canada and.. we have HBO. I'll have to wait for the youtube upload, I guess!
I am in Canada as well, just go the US HBO site and you can watch the videos fine. That's what I do.
I CAN NOT WAIT for this! OMG.

so excited about the series, everything is looking perfect!

well, the only thing which is disapointing me is the look of Jon Snow in all photos and videos. He's definitely one of my favourite charakters and like for many others one I can identify with in the books.
But in my mind he's a completely different character as the one I see on the Photos. I don't like his sadish look, Jon Snow was never sad-looking in the books, only stern. And I don't like his hair and his beard and his nose and his overall attitude and...
Sad, but I guess you can't expect to get every aspect exactly like you imagined...

i agree with oteckre on jon snow - he reminds me a bit of a latino from the looks (hair, beard) - not at all like his father...

but compliments on the rest of the casting and on the general atmosphere of the teaser! can't wait to see the real thing :)
comments.subject: everything but jon

comments.article:
and more intimate than i'd considered before. lord of the rings was this great, sweeping epic, and it got some small moments down, but thrones looks like it really will nail down the character scenes with proper scale and respect.

can't wait for next sunday.
comments.subject: looks great

comments.article: Saw it! Got chills. And yeah--Giants AND Jets...a good day.
It may sound hackneyed, but this teaser just sent a shiver down my spine ...
comments.subject: Teaser

comments.article:
I truly am speechless...this is so exciting! I am not ashamed to admit that I got teary-eyed when I saw this! It looks and sounds so wonderful!?!?!? "Fear...is for the winter..." how awesome is that!

The last time anything had an impact like this on me was when I saw the teasers for "The Lord Of The Rings" trilogy...of course having Sean Bean in the HBO preview brings up loads of good memories!

Fantastic!
comments.subject: WOWWWWW

comments.article: Any chance this could be cross posted to YouTube (or similar). I suspect it can't be viewed in Canada :( (I've had this issue before)
comments.subject: Canada?

comments.article:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6JbpGxH_DDM

Get it before they take it down...
comments.subject: Re: Canada?

comments.article: It was great.  I'm glad Bean doesn't seem to be resurrecting Boromir in his Ned, Tyrion looks amazing, and that was my first peek at Joff!  :)  Also, that was the first scene where Jaime looked appropriately hot.  I'm not sure why Dany doesn't have purple eyes but I'll let that one slide for now.

My bigger problem with Dany is that they didn't dye her eyebrows, so she just looks like she has a bad dye job on her hair. Otherwise, I love the wide-eyed look of innocence on her face in the clips we've seen.

Increible, impresionante, alucinante !!! Todo lo que se puede decir es poco....

Incredible, awesome !!! Winter is coming, yeah, but why not Spring is coming? ;-D
comments.subject: Una pasada !!!

comments.article: Can anyone tell me who actually made the arms and armor for this series?  They are beautiful from what I can see so far
comments.subject: Re: Una pasada !!!

comments.article:
It's a huge accomplishment to have written books so beautifully detailed that a screen version can perfectly embody our mental images. Thank you for giving the world your work!
Also...I'm overjoyed that those of us outside of the U.S. can watch the short HBO videos!
Not to be a total scrub, but who's the fellow whipping out his sword at 27 seconds in?

This looks like it's going to be absolutely amazing, and I can't wait to see it :)

Any word on if iTunes will carry the show? I travel far too much to catch it on traditional media unfortunately.

At present, I'm not aware of any service that allows you to purchase or rent individual HBO episodes as they're airing. Once they release a season of something on DVD, they'll usually release them for download on Amazon VOD, Playstation Store, iTunes, etc..., but, of course, that's nearly a year later.

It is somewhat frustrating. I love HBO and consider it to have the highest quality shows on television, but the fact of the matter is that my wife and I just don't watch any TV other than HBO, and so we recently decided to cancel Comcast all-together. Once Game of Thrones comes out, we'll re-subscribe for 10 weeks (or however long the season lasts), but we'll probably cancel it again immediately afterwards.
